intro: Euphrasia bicolor, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically range in color from white to yellow. The plant is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, while the flowers are arranged in loose spikes. Euphrasia bicolor is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
